scripts.help:help: echo Prints a list of available scripts and a reminder about how to get more help.
scripts.help: echo Available scripts -- execute \`npm run help:SCRIPTNAME\` for help on SCRIPTNAME: && (npm run | grep '^\s\s\S' | grep -v 'help\|only\|postinstall\|prepare')
scripts.help:dev-1: echo Compiles frontscope and starts a server running it.
scripts.help:dev-2: echo Note the server will hot-reload the code from any
scripts.help:dev-3: echo source files as they change, to ease development.
scripts.help:dev:workbench-1: echo Compiles frontscope and starts a server running it in workbench mode,
scripts.help:dev:workbench-2: echo "with the visualizers in the 'visualizers-workbench' directory loaded."
scripts.help:dev:workbench-3: echo "Hot-reloads code changes, just like the 'dev' script."
scripts.help:doc:serve-1: echo "This is like the 'dev' script, but for the"
scripts.help:doc:serve-2: echo embedded documentation rather than the
scripts.help:doc:serve:workbench-1: echo "This is like the 'dev:workbench' script, but"
scripts.help:doc:serve:workbench-2: echo for the embedded documentation rather than the
scripts.help:build:1: echo Compiles frontscope and minifies the result,
scripts.help:build:2: echo producing a bundle ready for installation
scripts.help:preview:1: echo Runs build and then serves the resulting site
scripts.help:preview:3: echo for you to browse. This script differs from
scripts.help:preview:4: echo "'dev' in that there isn't any hot module"
scripts.help:preview:5: echo reload. It is what runs in production.
scripts.help:preview:cmd: echo Previews w/o rebuild; needed for e2e tests.
scripts.help:test:unit: echo Typechecks and runs unit tests.
scripts.help:test:e2e: echo Runs end-to-end in-browser tests via Docker.
scripts.help:test:e2e:cmd-2: echo However, note that it does not rebuild
scripts.help:test:e2e:cmd-3: echo before it runs, and some tests are not
scripts.help:test:e2e:cmd-4: echo reproducible outside of Docker, so be
scripts.help:test:e2e:cmd-5: echo careful -- this script exists mostly for
scripts.help:test:e2e:report: echo Runs e2e and opens report in browser
scripts.help:test:e2e:ui: echo Runs interactive end-to-end tests directly.
scripts.test:e2e:ui: npm run build && npm run test:e2e:cmd -- --ui
scripts.help:typecheck:1: echo Checks for TypeScript errors in both .vue
scripts.help:lintx:01: echo If you would like to format your code before
scripts.help:lintx:02: echo you make a commit with git -- which has hooks
scripts.help:lintx:03: echo to check the formatting -- call this script at
scripts.help:lintx:05: echo on the project files. Note that this operation
scripts.help:lintx:06: echo does not simply _check_ the formatting of your
scripts.help:lintx:07: echo files, it _formats_ them! At least, if possible;
scripts.help:lintx:08: echo there are some formatting/code errors that it
scripts.help:lintx:09: echo does not know how to fix. These will simply be
scripts.help:lintx:11: echo If any such issues are present at the time of a
scripts.help:lintx:12: echo commit, presuming the standard git hooks that
scripts.help:lintx:13: echo this project sets up are in place, the commit
scripts.help:lint:check-1: echo "This is like the 'lint' script, but it"
scripts.help:lint:check-2: echo only shows what changes would be made and
scripts.help:lint:check-3: echo reports any unresolved problems; it does
scripts.help:lint:check-4: echo not modify any of your source files.
scripts.postinstall: git config --local include.path ../.gitconfig && python3 -m venv .venv && cd tools && node pyrun.mjs python -m pip install -U pip && node pyrun.mjs pip install -r requirements.txt
